paper_abstract: In this paper, the H-infinity control problem is studied for nonlinear stochastic Markov jump systems with state, control and external disturbance-dependent noise ((x, u, v)-dependent noise for short). A sufficient condition is derived for the infinite horizon H-infinity control of such systems in terms of a set of coupled second-order Hamilton-Jacobi inequalities (HJIs). In general, it is difficult to solve these coupled HJIs. By using fuzzy approach, the infinite horizon H-infinity control design for nonlinear stochastic Markov jump systems is developed via solving a set of linear matrix inequalities (LMIs) instead of HJIs. Two numerical examples are presented to illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed design methods. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Infinite horizon H-infinity control for nonlinear stochastic Markov jump systems with (x, u, v)-dependent noise via fuzzy approach
